title: Why cant leona proc her passive on monsters?
body: It would honestly really help her clears go a lot faster and not make her unbalanced in lanes other then the jungle. She has the slowest clears of any tank right now

replies.body:
Leona can't proc her own passive. This way, it allows her to be usefull as a support, but not overly powerful as a jungler or a solo lane (can you imagine a tank like leona having the same passive as lux?)

>Passive: Leona's abilities each mark enemies hit with Sunlight for 3.5 seconds. Any damage dealt by ally champions will consume Sunlight, dealing 20 - 105 (based on level) bonus magic damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=bya8Ofu5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-02-16T06:16:22.999+0000)
>
> Leona can't proc her own passive. This way, it allows her to be usefull as a support, but not overly powerful as a jungler or a solo lane (can you imagine a tank like leona having the same passive as lux?)


But making her able to proc it on monsters wouldn't make her overly powerful in any role she wont be able to kill anyone faster because of it, it would just allow her clears to no longer be the slowest clear of anyone in the game,  She isn't even close to nautilus's clear speed. (I already stated this in the original post actually lol i never said anything about proccing it on minions or champions)

In all honesty, it wouldn't be overpowered if she could.

She would make a great solo laner, but Riot has this garbage ass mentality of 

"We want the game to be diverse and full of interesting builds, but we are going to heavily limit you and potentially punish you for playing anything that we don't deem meta"


cancerous twat devs
